# __Operational Subjective Statistical Methods__ { .unnumbered }

> _The thesis we propound ... is that scientific reasoning is reasoning in accordance with the calculus
> of probabilities._ [@HowsonUrbach2006, p. 10]

> _The logic of probability merely formalizes the coherent implications of specified beliefs about events
> when the beliefs are expressed in a graded scale from 0 (complete denial) to 1 (complete affirmation).
> This logic is relevant to_ ___anyone's___ _uncertain knowledge about any unknown observable quantities.
> The "scientific method" empowers the scientist with precisely the same inferential principles that it
> empowers the person on the street in the conduct of daily affairs, no more and no less._ [@Lad1996, p. 13]
